name: Waydroid
description: Waydroid is a container-based platform for running Android applications on Linux systems. This implementation provides full GPU acceleration support (Intel, AMD, NVIDIA) with hardware-accelerated rendering, VNC remote access for Android desktop, Home Assistant REST API integration, clipboard sharing, audio passthrough, and optional Google Play Store integration. Perfect for smart home automation, controlling Android-only IoT devices, running security camera applications, or any use case requiring Android application execution on Proxmox VE.

notes.text: Access Android via VNC: Connect to <container-ip>:5900 using your VNC client with credentials displayed during installation
GPU Acceleration: Supports Intel, AMD, and NVIDIA GPUs with automatic detection. Software rendering available for unprivileged containers
Google Play Store: Optional installation of GAPPS (Google Apps) available during setup
Home Assistant Integration: REST API available at http://<container-ip>:8080 with authentication token saved to /etc/waydroid-api/token
First Boot: Container startup takes 2-3 minutes while Android initializes. Monitor progress via container logs
Clipboard Sharing: Seamless clipboard integration between host and Android container for copy-paste operations
Audio Support: Automatic PulseAudio/PipeWire audio passthrough enables sound from Android applications
Update Capability: Re-run installation script with --update flag to update existing Waydroid installations without data loss
Requires kernel modules: binder_linux and ashmem_linux are auto-loaded during installation
Privileged Container: GPU acceleration requires privileged container. Use unprivileged mode with --unprivileged flag for software rendering only
